0: The FAA said it suspended an air-traffic controller and his supervisor for losing contact with aircraft when the controller inadvertently transmitted the soundtrack of a movie he was watching on a personal video player. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Federal Aviation Administration made the suspensions public Monday, the same day agency chief Randy Babbitt began a nationwide tour of air-traffic facilities to push new guidelines to counter controller fatigue and stress the importance of professionalism to the country's 15,000 controllers.
